summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) documenting a voluntary interview of a Federal Bureau of Prisons Correctional Systems Officer at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview was conducted as part of the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The memorandum lists several attachments, including the interview transcript and prison logs from August 2019.

persons.name: Dennis Matulewicz
persons.role: Senior Special Agent, DOJ Office of the Inspector General
persons.context: Conducted the voluntary interview of the BOP officer as part of the OIG investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; a previously housed inmate at MCC New York who died.

persons.name: Ryan Geach
persons.role: Assistant Special Agent in Charge, DOJ Office of the Inspector General
persons.context: Reviewed and signed the investigation memorandum.

connections.description: Matulewicz was investigating Epstein's death as part of the OIG inquiry.

events.title: OIG Interview of BOP Officer
events.description: Senior Special Agent Dennis Matulewicz and a Special Agent conducted a voluntary interview of a Correctional Systems Officer at MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Log Entry
events.description: A Form PP38 Daily Log was created at MCC New York, referenced as an attachment to the investigation.

events.title: MCC New York Count Documentation
events.description: Count documentation from MCC New York at 12 a.m., referenced as an attachment to the investigation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) was actively investigating the death of Jeffrey Epstein as of August 2021.
The investigation involved interviewing a Federal Bureau of Prisons Correctional Systems Officer who worked at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York where Epstein was held.

The memorandum references several key prison documents from August 2019, including daily logs, assignment rosters, and count sheets, suggesting a focus on prison procedures and conditions around the time of Epstein's death.
The interviewed BOP officer's name is redacted in the provided text, indicated by the blank space and reference to 'CSO'.
